verses.verse: And Naomi<WH5281> her mother-in<WH2545>-law said<WH559> unto her<WH1323>, My daughter, shall I not seek<WH1245> rest<WH4494> for thee<WH3190>, that it may be well with thee?
And now is not Boaz<WH1162> our kinsman<WH4130>, with whose maidens<WH5291> thou wast<WH2219>? Behold, he winnoweth barley<WH8184> to-night<WH3915> in the threshing-floor<WH1637>.

Wash <WH7364> thyself therefore<WH5480>, and anoint thee<WH7760>, and put thy raiment<WH8071> upon thee<WH3381>, and get thee down to the threshing-floor<WH1637>, but make not thyself known<WH3045> unto the man<WH376>, until he shall have done<WH3615> eating<WH398> and drinking<WH8354>.

And it shall be<WH7901>, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark<WH3045> the place<WH4725> where he shall lie<WH7901>, and thou shalt go in<WH935>, and uncover<WH1540> his feet<WH4772>, and lay thee down<WH7901>; and he will tell<WH5046> thee what thou shalt do<WH6213>.
And she said<WH559> unto her<WH559>, All that thou sayest I will do<WH6213>.
And she went down<WH3381> unto the threshing-floor<WH1637>, and did<WH6213> according to all that her mother-in<WH2545>-law bade her<WH6680>.

And when Boaz<WH1162> had eaten<WH398> and drunk<WH8354>, and his heart<WH3820> was merry<WH3190>, he went<WH935> to lie down<WH7901> at the end<WH7097> of the heap of grain<WH6194>: and she came<WH935> softly<WH3909>, and uncovered<WH1540> his feet<WH4772>, and laid her down<WH7901>.
And it came to pass at midnight<WH2677>, that the man<WH376> was afraid<WH2729>, and turned<WH3943> himself<WH802>; and, behold, a woman lay<WH7901> at his feet<WH4772>.

And he said<WH559>, Who art thou<WH559>? And she answered, I am Ruth<WH7327> thy handmaid<WH519>: spread<WH6566> therefore thy skirt<WH3671> over thy handmaid<WH519>; for thou art a near kinsman<WH1350>.

And he said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be thou of Jehovah<WH3068>, my daughter<WH1323>: thou hast showed<WH3190> more kindness<WH2617> in the latter end<WH314> than at the beginning<WH7223>, inasmuch as thou followedst<WH3212> not<WH1115> young men<WH970>, whether poor<WH1800> or rich<WH6223>.

And now<WH1323>, my daughter, fear<WH3372> not<WH6213>; I will do to thee all that thou sayest<WH559>; for all the city<WH8179> of my people<WH5971> doth know<WH3045> that thou art a worthy<WH2428> woman<WH802>.
And now it is true<WH551> that I am a near kinsman<WH1350>; howbeit there is<WH3426> a kinsman<WH1350> nearer than I<WH7138>.

Tarry <WH3885> this night<WH3915>, and it shall be in the morning<WH1242>, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman<WH1350>, well<WH2896>; let him do the kinsman<WH1350>'s part: but if he will<WH2654> not do the part of a kinsman<WH1350> to thee<WH1350>, then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee<WH3068>, as Jehovah liveth<WH2416>: lie down<WH7901> until the morning<WH1242>.

And she lay<WH7901> at his feet<WH4772> until the morning<WH1242>. And she rose up<WH6965> before<WH2958> one<WH376> could discern<WH5234> another<WH7453>. For he said<WH559>, Let it not be known<WH3045> that the woman<WH802> came<WH935> to the threshing-floor<WH1637>.

And he said<WH559>, Bring<WH3051> the mantle<WH4304> that is upon thee<WH270>, and hold it<WH270>; and she held it<WH4058>; and he measured six<WH8337> measures of barley<WH8184>, and laid<WH7896> it on her<WH935>: and he went into the city<WH5892>.
And when she came<WH935> to her mother-in<WH2545>-law, she said<WH559>, Who art thou<WH1323>, my daughter? And she told<WH559> her all that the man<WH376> had done to her<WH6213>.
And she said<WH559>, These six<WH8337> measures of barley<WH8184> gave<WH5414> he me<WH559>; for he said, Go<WH935> not empty<WH7387> unto thy mother-in<WH2545>-law.

Then said<WH559> she<WH3427>, Sit still, my daughter<WH1323>, until thou know<WH3045> how the matter<WH1697> will fall<WH5307>; for the man<WH376> will not rest<WH8252>, until<WH518> he have finished<WH3615> the thing<WH1697> this day<WH3117>.
